meanings.definition: A member of a military unit trained to parachute from airplanes into combat zones.
meanings.sent1: The brave paratroop landed behind enemy lines.
meanings.sent2: The paratroop jumped out of the plane with precision.
meanings.sent3: The paratroop accidentally landed in a tree during training.
meanings.sent4: The paratroop descended from the sky like a silent ghost.
meanings.sent5: The paratroop's red uniform stood out against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: To drop paratroopers from an aircraft by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The pilot had to paratroop the soldiers into the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The commander decided to paratroop the troops at dawn.
meanings.sent3: The instructor joked that he would paratroop the recruits into the swimming pool.
meanings.sent4: The cargo plane will paratroop supplies to the remote village.
meanings.sent5: The general ordered to paratroop reinforcements to the front lines.
